TopicTitle: Workarounds for Cargo Bay Heat Explosions?

Articles.Content:
Here's the problem:

I've built a vertically launched lander out of Mk2 parts. One of its parts is the short Mk2 cargo bay. This cargo bay is ruining the whole thing because it suddenly, for no reason, gets very hot and causes the parts in it and/or attached to its ends, which can't take that much heat, to explode. I'm seeking a workaround to this problem. I've got Claw's Stock Bug Fixes but can't remember if it has one for this issue. If it does, it's not working.

The problem unfolds as follows:

1. Launch the rocket. It goes up normally and smoothly, with little if any flames appearing during ascent.

2. At MEKO (usually about 40km), F11 shows the entire ship the dark red, can't-get-any-cooler color. The air is getting thinner, there are neither flames nor mach effects showing, and the engines aren't running, so the rocket should in fact be cooling off as it coasts.

3. Suddenly, at about 60-65km, the F11 colors show the cargo bay, and ONLY the cargo bay, ramp up to an incandescent yellow color in about 1/2 a second. This causes parts in or adjacent to the cargo bay to explode. Once a part has exploded, the cargo bay itself then instantly drops back down the cold red color. 

The above is what happens at Kerbin. I also HyperEdited the ship to Duna, landed it there, and had the same problem during takeoff. Somewhere between MEKO and the top of the atmosphere, the cargo bay superheats and explodes its contents and/or neighbors. And at Duna, the it got neither flames nor mach effects going up or down and was always cold red in the F11 view.

I've never had this problem with SSTOs. The only difference I can see between this lander and an SSTO, as far as the cargo bay is concerned, is that on the lander the door of the cargo bay is crossed by a long telescoping ladder. The ladder is attached to the part above the cargo bay and no part of the ladder comes in contact with the bay or its doors, but it's there. The reason for the ladder is not only so Kerbals can reach the ground but also, if I open the bay, run the experiments, then lower the ladder, the Kerbal can grab the science data from the experiments in the bay.

(Side note: Kerbal jetpacks are now insufficient for flying on Duna so your Duna landers must have ladders. Which is a bummer because how are we going to get up on top of the Face now?)

Anyway, is there a way work around this problem? Thanks in advance.

I'd also submit a bug report.

My bug fixes don't include this one. I've not done much investigation into this one myself. Might be something I can look into in between this claw time warp bug.

Cheers

-Claw

Redesign the bay. Every time I've had this happen, rearranging the deck chairs made it go away. Be careful with clipping into the bay walls as well. If a redesign isn't an option, don't time warp with the vessel active.

Hmmm. The weird thing is, the Kraken-heat here demands a sacrifice. Once it destroys a part, it goes away. So IMHO it's better for something minor inside the bay to explode rather than one of the main structural parts outside the bay on either end. When those blow up, the ship gets torn in half.

There's already a bug report about runway cargo bay heating. I'll read it again but I don't think I have anything of substance to add to it.

> 
> Redesign the bay. Every time I've had this happen, rearranging the deck chairs made it go away. Be careful with clipping into the bay walls as well. If a redesign isn't an option, don't time warp with the vessel active.

In my case, I had a Mk2 cockpit, then the Mk2 probe core, the short cargo bay, then a Mk2-to-2.5m adaptor. There was no clipping in the bay. The bay originally contained the following items:

\* Surface attached to the front bulkhead (rear surface of probe core): 2 each USI small radial supply and mulch packs

\* Stacked on the rear internal node: A 1.25m reaction wheel, a Science Jr., and a Goo

In this arrangement, the probe core exploded during launch between MEKO and the top of the atmosphere, knocking the cockpit off the ship. Sic transit Kerbals.

So I made the following changes (again, no clipping):

\* Replaced the Mk2 probe core with a 2.5m probe core on the far side of the adaptor

\* Replaced the 1.25m reaction wheel with a 2.5m unit on the far side of the adaptor

\* Had the internal stack just be the Science Jr. with the Goo on top, and radially attached the USI packs to the Science Jr.

In this configuration, it survived liftoff from Kerbin but on liftoff from Duna, the Science Jr. exploded.

The weird thing is, I've built horizontally launched SSTOs with bays arranged just like this and haven't had any overheating problems. Another strange thing is that this happens when the ship isn't warping, or running engines. It's just coasting without any flames showing, and F11 shows everything cold red. Then for no reason at all, the cargo bay suddenly gets very hot very fast.

> My bug fixes don't include this one. I've not done much investigation into this one myself. Might be something I can look into in between this claw time warp bug.

Well, if you do get a chance, it would be greatly appreciated.

Postulation: if the thing attached to the node is exploding, it is somehow clipping out of the bay occlusion zone.

Now that you mention it, it seems as if all my bay hearing issues are with the short bay. I have only developed one design where my bay starts with a short section in 1.0.4. Any design with the long bay had no issues.

Most my Mk2 bays attach to a fuel tank or crew cabin and the payload starts with a 1.25 m reaction wheel. (I have a subassembly with reaction wheel, solar, KER computer, and radial battery that all my Mk2 craft use)
